column4: hi i am buying a laptop and it says  the memory supported is 4GB - which says it requires 64bit OS
does this mean I can't use 32bit Ubuntu on it?
no, it means that if you use 32 bit ubuntu, you will only be able to access 3 Gb of your memory, with a normal kernel
but like bazhang, you can use a PAE kernel to get all the memory available
